item.title: Covid: Booster jabs for over-50s expected to be announced
item.description: A single dose of Pfizer will be offered at least six months after a second dose, the BBC understands.

item.title: Covid jab rollout for 12-to-15s to start in England's schools
item.description: Parental consent will be sought for the programme for children aged 12 to 15, the government says.

item.title: Covid: Which countries are vaccinating children and why?
item.description: Millions of children around the world are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Job vacancies at new record as furlough winds down
item.description: Official figures show the number of vacancies top one million for the first time since records began.

item.title: Prince Andrew's lawyer says NY case is baseless and non-viable
item.description: The Duke of York is being sued in New York over allegations of sexual assault by Virginia Giuffre.

item.title: Climate change: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
item.description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

item.title: Met Gala 2021: Celebrities show off lavish outfits in New York
item.description: This year's famous guests were inspired by everything from the Matrix to the Statue of Liberty.

item.title: Great British Bake Off 2021 contestants revealed
item.description: A police detective, a retired midwife and a software developer are among this year's hopefuls.

item.title: Boris Johnson's mother, Charlotte Johnson Wahl, dies aged 79
item.description: Charlotte Johnson Wahl died "suddenly and peacefully" in London on Monday, the PM's family says.

item.title: Scrap Covid tests for most travellers, says industry
item.description: The government has "choked off" travel trade and 70% of firms plan redundancies, says Abta.

item.title: Tanya Fear: Missing British actress found safe in LA
item.description: Tanya Fear was reported missing by friends and family, who said she had not been seen since last week.

item.title: Andrew Neil resigns from GB News three months after channel's launch
item.description: The ex-BBC broadcaster helped to launch the station and briefly appeared as its lead news anchor.

item.title: Climate change: Young people very worried - survey
item.description: Over half of respondents in a survey believe humanity is doomed and governments are failing to act.

item.title: The Papers: 'Jabs blitz' for winter as over-50s 'get boosters'
item.description: Many of the front pages focus on the expansion of the vaccine rollout as part of the PM's winter plan.

item.title: Taylor Swift: Pop star poses for selfies in Belfast
item.description: Wildest Dreams came true when the American pop princess visited the city.

item.title: China's Covid-fuelled surfing boom
item.description: Covid travel restrictions that have limited foreign travel have led to a boom in surfing in China.

item.title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
item.description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

item.title: Twenty years after 9/11, will al-Qaeda rise again?
item.description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

item.title: Canada federal election: A look at the key numbers driving the campaign
item.description: A visual guide to the big issues in Canada's federal election, from climate to cost of living.

item.title: 'We were so lucky to share eight incredible months with her'
item.description: Ashley Cain urges men dealing with bereavement to "talk about it" after the loss of his eight-month-old daughter to leukaemia.

item.title: Schoolboy cyclist outpaces pros on Tour of Britain
item.description: Xander Graham was watched on live TV as he raced alongside riders on the Tour of Britain near Edinburgh.

item.title: Green jobs: The new generation of workers making it work for them
item.description: Science editor David Shukman on three jobs in growing green industries, and what it's like to do them

item.title: Five things to take to university - and one to avoid
item.description: Brighten up your accommodation, make friends and cook nicer meals with these handy items.

item.title: Why even giant ships can't solve the shipping crisis
item.description: A shortage of vessels is hampering global trade and may lead to empty shelves before Christmas.

item.title: Russia election: Opposition crushed ahead of managed polls
item.description: Exiled or disqualified, opposition voices warn of a government stitch-up in this week’s elections.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion on resilience, celebrations and pleasing her parents
item.description: As Emma Raducanu basks in her new-found New York fame, she explains where she found the mental strength to win a Grand Slam title.

item.title: California recall election: Fact-checking Governor Newsom and his challengers
item.description: BBC News looks at some of the claims made by the governor and his challengers on the campaign trail.

item.title: MTV Awards 2021: More sparks fly on red carpet than on stage
item.description: After a scuffle on the red carpet, the ceremony struggles to generate many big new cultural moments.

item.title: Emma Raducanu set to earn millions after US Open win
item.description: Brands will be queuing up to secure sponsorship deals with the teenage tennis star, experts say.

item.title: 'It was rolling back the years... with a little help from my mum' - how Townsend got his belief back
item.description: Andros Townsend credits his mum for the wonder strike which helps Everton beat Burnley and continues their unbeaten start to the season.

item.title: Andy Murray: Emma Raducanu's US Open win 'very special', says three-time Grand Slam winner
item.description: Emma Raducanu's "very special" US Open win has gives British tennis with a "huge opportunity" to attract more people to the sport, says winner Andy Murray.

item.title: English threats, Spanish doubts & Messi in new colours - your essential guide to the Champions League
item.description: With the group stages getting under way this week, BBC Sport sets the scene for this season's intriguing Champions League.

item.title: Aston Martin want Vettel to stay and expect answer on his future 'imminently'
item.description: Aston Martin say they are committed to Sebastian Vettel and are keen for him to race for them in 2022.

item.title: How England's plans unravelled - and what does it mean for the Ashes?
item.description: On the back of their worst home summer since 1999, are England heading for a repeat of the hammering they took in Australia four years ago?

item.title: Nominate your unsung sporting hero for Sports Personality award
item.description: Sports Personality of the Year Unsung Hero celebrates the most dynamic and dedicated volunteers making a difference through grassroots sport and activity.

item.title: US Open highlights: Emma Raducanu beats Leylah Fernandez to win maiden Grand Slam
item.description: Watch the best shots as Emma Raducanu wins the women's US Open to become the first British female winner at Flushing Meadows since Virginia Wade in 1968 and the first qualifier in the Open era to win a Slam.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: The UK's four chief medical officers say all children aged 12-15 should be offered one vaccine dose.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: Covid passports: How do I get one and when will I need it?
item.description: People in Scotland will need to be fully vaccinated to go to clubs, sporting events and concerts.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid: Will I need a jab and what will university be like this term?
item.description: Many Covid restrictions have been lifted for students going to university this term.

item.title: Covid symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Stamp duty holiday: How much do I have to pay now?
item.description: Stamp duty rules are changing in England and Northern Ireland

item.title: Covid: Will children get the vaccine and will I need a booster?
item.description: Healthy children aged 12 and over are likely to be offered one dose of the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's population, as more than 48 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Universal credit: When will the £20 increase stop?
item.description: The government has confirmed the £20 boost will end in the autumn.

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: The hard men removing squatters in Spain
item.description: Some squatters in Spain demand cash before leaving - so eviction firms have arisen to handle the talks.

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.
